body_html: It's a lot slower because every indexing operation you're doing in here is recorded in a graph, because you might potentially want to differentiate it. This takes the majority of time. I'd recommend doing var.sort(dim=1), which will be equally fast on Variables and Tensors, and much faster than using sorted.

I'd recommend doing var.sort(dim=1), which will be equally fast on Variables and Tensors, and much faster than using sorted.
body: It's a lot slower because every indexing operation you're doing in here is recorded in a graph, because you might potentially want to differentiate it. This takes the majority of time. I'd recommend doing `var.sort(dim=1)`, which will be equally fast on Variables and Tensors, and much faster than using `sorted`.
